intro: Leucas hamatula, commonly known as the hairy leucas, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are hairy and often have a serrated edge, while the flowers are small and yellowish. Leucas hamatula is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
